soul.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the part of a person that is not physical, and that contains their character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that a person’s soul continues to exist after they have died.
soul.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: It was as if those grey eyes could see into the very depths of her soul.
the restlessness deep in his soul
soul.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used in particular phrases to mean a person
soul.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He is really quite a sensitive soul.
I promise I won’t tell a soul.
The night was dark and still, and there was not a soul in sight.
not a soul in sight/not a soul to be seen
The poor old soul had fallen and broken her hip.
soul.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a type of popular music that often expresses deep emotions, usually performed by black singers and musicians
soul.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He listens to a lot of soul.
soul.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the ability to be emotionally affected by art, music, literature etc
soul.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: My brother thinks that anyone who doesn’t like poetry has no soul.
soul.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the quality that affects people emotionally, that a painting, piece of music etc can have
soul.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Her performance was technically perfect, but it lacked soul.
soul.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the special quality or part that gives something its true character
soul.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Basho’s poems capture the true soul of old Japan.
